resources.string: In order to use your account <%s>, you must update the security settings on your device. Contact your administrator for more information.
Auto-download attachments to recent messages via WiFi
This action requires an Internet connection
Conversation view has been turned off to match your account settings. You can change this in Settings.
Conversation view has been turned on to match your account settings. You can change this in Settings.
Username, password and other incoming server settings
Username, password and other outgoing server settings
If you also use a personal or Exchange email, add it now.
Confirm that username, password and account settings are correct.
Your username or password is incorrect.
"You've typed an incorrect server address or the server requires a protocol version that Email doesn't support."
Gmailify brings the best of Gmail to your ^1 account. Better spam protection and email categories keep your inbox clean. You can switch back at any time. ^2
By default, all new emails will be sent from this address:
This account has already been Gmailified and syncs to your %1$s account. Are you sure you also want to add it as a separate account?
Your account has been set up and you may now change the name displayed on sent emails
Your account is set up and emails are on their way!
Automatically download attachments when connected to WiFi
"Account sync is off. Turn it on in Account settings."
To enable us to serve better ads in the future, please tell us why you dismissed the ad:
For faster access, add Gmail to your home screen.
This action has been disabled. Please contact your IT admin to learn more.
You will be able to read your emails through the %1$s app.

"Allow users to add or remove any Exchange account, other than the account specified in this managed configuration. If this setting is enabled, you can't prevent users from adding other Exchange accounts to Gmail. You also can't control data sharing between other apps and Exchange accounts added by users. This setting should only be enabled if your users need to maintain more than one work Exchange account in Gmail."

A value from 0-5 that represents the time window for syncing with EAS (Exchange ActiveSync). Defaults to one week (value = 3). [0 = No filter, synchronise all items. 1 = 1 day. 2 = 3 days. 3 = 1 week. 4 = 2 weeks. 5 = 1 month.] See https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-gb/library/gg709713(v=exchg.80).aspx for complete information about sync window settings.
A string comprising the default email signature to be appended to the bottom of all outbound email message text.

A list of strings containing the permitted authentication types, which are Modern Authentication (allow_modern_authentication) and Basic Authentication (allow_basic_authentication). If nothing is provided, both Basic and Modern Authentication are allowed.

A string containing the EAS (Exchange ActiveSync) device ID, which may be used by some EMM gateways to correlate devices (this setting is ignored when set to empty or an Exchange account is already presented in the managed profile).
A non-empty string alias for a private key certificate stored in the work-profile key store by an EMM’s DPC app that will be used for authenticating to the ActiveSync servers.
A boolean value that enables and requires SSL on port numbers used with Hostname when set to True (default). (This setting is ignored when port 443 is used in Hostname.)

A boolean value that disables validation checks on SSL certificates used in communications between ActiveSync servers, proxies or gateways, and other email servers. Set to True to disable validation checks when using self-signed certificates or for testing purposes only. By default, this value is False: validation checks are performed. This value must always be set to False in production. When set to True, Gmail is vulnerable to man-in-the-middle attacks, and communication with servers and proxies may be insecure.
Trust all certificates (Warning: for testing purposes only)

"A variable field for the user's Active Directory username that can be specified as a direct username (janedoe) or templated value ($username$). The username and user's email address may be different."
Accounts that do not support archiving as an action will instead offer deleting.
"Why is this message in Spam? You've blocked incoming messages from %1$s."
"Why is this message in Spam? It seems to be a fake 'bounce' reply to a message that you didn't actually send."
Scheduled send cancelled and message reverted to draft
Scheduled message cannot be deleted while offline
Certificate subject and host name mismatch
Try updating the port and/or security type to add this account.
Availability information retrieved from Google Calendar
Stop displaying inline images from senders that you have previously allowed.
"All of the searches that you've previously performed will be removed."
"Are you sure that you'd like to stop receiving similar messages from %s?"
"Are you sure that you'd like to stop receiving similar messages from this sender?"
Gmail needs permission to access your contacts. Please enable contacts permission in Settings.
"Can't snooze to time that has already passed"
"Why is this message in Spam? It's similar to messages that have been detected by our spam filters."
"WARNING: Deactivating the Gmail app's authority to administer your device will delete all email accounts that require it, along with their email, contacts, calendar events and other data."
"Can't connect to the server. Try re-entering your password, or contact your IT admin for more information."
"Can't connect to server. Try selecting another certificate or re-entering your password, or contact your IT admin for more information."
%1$s requires you to update your security settings
"To use this account, go back to the previous screen and choose 'Outlook, Hotmail and Live'"
Oops, we had some problems connecting.

"This person's name is similar to a name in your organisation but the email address does not belong to your domain or the email is not authenticated. Avoid clicking on links or replying with sensitive information unless you contact the sender by another means to ensure that this email is legitimate."
Items that have been in Spam for more than 30 days will be automatically deleted.
Items that have been in the bin for more than 30 days will be automatically deleted.
Connect to the Internet for more results
This event has been cancelled for: %s
Gmail needs storage permission to complete action. Please enable it in Settings.
Could not forward one or more attachments
As you add people to this message, this icon will let you know that your message is secure. ^1
Your message will be sent using standard security
Please contact your administrator to confirm that the proper keys needed for decryption have been set up correctly.
Try Gmailify for a cleaner, more organised inbox
Authentication error while connecting to email provider.
Updating your inbox. This may take a while.
Your inbox is being updated with better spam protection and email categories. This may take a while.
With Gmailify, you get the best of Gmail with your current email account. This includes better spam protection, and email categories to organise your inbox. You can switch back at any time. ^1
"Can't link your account at the moment. Please try again later from account settings."
By default, your emails will be sent from:
"A copy of your emails will be synced to Gmail and kept in this mailbox. Your email address won't change. ^1"

"Gmail could not verify that this message actually came from a member of your organisation. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information unless you're confident that this email is legitimate."
"%s sync is off. Turn it on in Inbox settings."
"Why is this message in Spam? It's written in a different language to the one that you usually use."
Certain file types (such as Zip) are not supported in confidential mode. Please remove your unsupported attachment(s) or disable confidential mode.
A phone number is required so that recipients can verify their identity with an SMS passcode.
Account \"%s\" needs to log in from the browser.
Must log in from the browser
"Why is this message in Spam? It's similar to messages that have been detected by our spam filters."
"Be careful with this message. It contains content that's generally used to steal personal information."
Message reported as a phishing attack and moved to Spam.
Conversation marked as sent from a compromised account and moved to Spam.
"Why is this message in Spam? You've tried to unsubscribe from this sender but they didn't provide a way to do that, so new messages are put directly into Spam to keep them out of your inbox."
You need to be online to perform this operation
There was an error while searching online. Some results may be missing.
The recipient %s does not belong to your organisation and is not on your list of contacts. Be careful with sensitive information.
Be careful with this message. Many people have marked similar messages as phishing scams, so this might contain unsafe content.
Be careful with this message. Many people have marked similar messages as spam.
You need to change your lock-screen PIN or password soon, or the data for %s will be erased. Do you want to change it now?
\"%s\" requires you to change your lock-screen PIN or password.
The data for %s is being erased from your device. You can restore it by changing your lock-screen PIN or password. Do you want to change it now?
Your lock-screen PIN or password has expired.
Email address or password is incorrect
Allows the app to access your email database, including received messages, sent messages, usernames and passwords.
Be careful with this message. One or more members of your organisation have marked this email as suspicious. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information.
Why is this message in Spam? Your organisation has requested that messages like this be marked as spam.
"This message was not sent to Spam, based on your organisation's request."
Group emails in the same conversation for IMAP and POP3 accounts
Group emails in the same conversation for IMAP, POP3 and Exchange accounts
Highlight high-value emails in bundles and show rich previews (i.e. deal badges, logos, images)
Messages from online groups, discussion boards and mailing lists
Personal, auto-generated updates, including confirmations, receipts, bills and statements
"Person-to-person conversations and messages that don't appear in other categories. To receive all emails in one inbox, untick all others."
Deals, offers and other marketing emails
Messages from social networks, media-sharing sites, online dating services
Emails that you might have forgotten to respond to will appear at the top of your inbox
Sent emails that you might need to follow up on will appear at the top of your inbox
"You need to pull down from the top of your inbox to refresh and won't receive notifications."
Show occasional tips for unsubscribing from bulk senders that you rarely read

"When you open the detailed view of a person, Google tries to give you more info.
To do this, Google may temporarily use info shared with you or saved on this device, like an email address or phone number. Google doesn’t save these details."
Allows the app to access information about your emails.
To use Gmail, you need a Google Account.
Stay in control with customisable tabs
"Get the emails you want, not the spam you don't"
Unable to save without storage permission
You blocked %1$s. Future messages from this address will be marked as spam.
There was a problem with securing the connection.
You can use this app with all of your email addresses. ^1
You can now add all of your email addresses. ^1
"Be careful with this message. Similar messages have been used to steal people's personal information. Unless you trust the sender, don't click links or reply with personal information."
Malicious emails often link to this site. Are you sure that you want to proceed to %1$s?
"Everything you snooze goes into Snoozed until it's time to return to the inbox"
"Similar messages were used to steal people's personal information. Unless you trust the sender, don't click any links or reply with any personal information."
Add this suggestion to the reply text field

"Be careful with this message. It contains a suspicious link that has been used to steal people's personal information. Unless you trust the sender, don't click links or reply with personal information."
You can choose from archive, delete, snooze and more
There was a problem while syncing this folder. Please try again later.
"Task sync is off. Turn it on in Account settings."
Changes you make to all apps and accounts, not just Gmail, will be synchronised between the web, your other devices and your %1$s.
This action is only supported by Gmail accounts. If it is not available, swiping in this direction will be disabled.
"Why is this message in Spam? You clicked 'Report phishing' for this message."
"Why is this message in Spam? You clicked 'Report spam' for this message."
Out of Office AutoReply changes discarded
Out of Office AutoReply changes saved
Send to my contacts and outside %s only
You can only send or request money using %1$s. Please change the ‘From’ address.
"This account isn't set up to sync automatically. Tap "Sync Now to sync emails once, or Change Sync Settings to set up this account to sync emails automatically.
"Sorry, but we can't change your email address while you are syncing your contacts. Please wait for it to finish and try again"
"The sender's email address uses abnormal characters, which might be used to spoof real addresses. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying to this message."
This message contains one or more attachments that cannot be verified as safe.
It contains links to websites that are hosting malware. Avoid clicking links in the message.
This message contains one or more encrypted attachments that cannot be scanned for viruses. Avoid downloading them unless you know the sender and are confident that this email is legitimate.
Gmail could not verify that it actually came from %1$s. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information.

"Similar messages were used to steal people's personal information. Moreover, Gmail could not verify that this message actually came from %1$s. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information."

"Gmail could not verify that this message actually came from a member of your organisation. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information unless you're confident that this email is legitimate."
Your organisation requested that messages like these be marked as spam.
"It's written in a different language from the one your messages generally use."
Many people marked similar messages as phishing scams, so this might contain unsafe content. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information.
Many people marked similar messages as phishing scams, so this might contain unsafe content. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information.
One or more members of your organisation have marked this email as suspicious. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information.
"This message was not sent to Spam in accordance with your organisation's settings."
"Similar messages were used to steal people's personal information. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information."
It might be trying to steal your personal information. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information unless you trust the sender.

"The sender's account may have been compromised. Avoid clicking links, downloading attachments or replying with personal information. If you know the sender, consider alerting them (but avoid replying to this email)."
Gmail lets you get straight to the good stuff by sorting out Promotional and Social emails.
One app for all of your emails
"Why is this message in Spam? You've tried to unsubscribe from this sender but they are continuing to send you emails, so new messages are put directly into Spam to keep them out of your inbox."
Allows the app to modify your Gmail, including sending and deleting emails.
